titleStmt.title: John Pritchett, Sr. et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4314

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
To His Excellency
Thos E. Bramlette Esqr
Gov. of Kentucky --

Your petitioners represent that they are well acquainted with Mrs Mariah Dixon of Henderson County who is about sixty five years old, a widow, in very limited circumstances, and an illiterate woman. That she was recognized to appear in the Henderson Circuit Court at its December Term 1862 to appear testify in a prosecution against one Overfield. They believe her failure to attend in obedience to the recognizance was owing to her feble health and the inclemency of the weather. At the June term 1863, judgment was rendered against her for $100, on forfeiture of the recognizance taken at the term preceding And they believe that the reason she made no defense was because she was not aware that it was necessary They respectfully ask your Excellency to remit the judgement rendered against her

John Pritchett Sr
B. F. Wood
Dluey Pritchett
Jacob Matson
Robert Brown
Hiram Whitledge
G. W. Boone
Joseph Purnell
W W Minton
L. W. Powell
L. H. Powell
William C Gibson
William T handley
manuel oufet
Charles Dixon
Nathan Harris
John Cook
